p: A depside, 4-(1-hydroxylprop-1-en-1-yl) atranorin-1-carboxylic acid ( 84), was obtained from Dirinaria picta, a lichen epiphyte of Elaeis guineensis palm trees, collected in Port Harcourt, Rivers State. It showed some antiplasmodial activity with IC 50 value of 37 μg/mL, and low toxicity to mammalian HeLa cells (IC 50 = 100 μg/mL) (Afieroho et al., 2018).
